28#include <sys/file.h>
29#include <errno.h>
30#include <fcntl.h>
31#include <inttypes.h>
32#include <stddef.h>
33#include <stdlib.h>
34#include <string.h>
35#include <time.h>
36#include <unistd.h>

38#include "config.h"
39#include "auth.h"
40#include "dhcp.h"
41#include "dhcp6.h"
42#include "dhcpcd.h"

44#ifdef HAVE_HMAC_H
45#include <hmac.h>
46#endif
47
48#ifdef __sun
49#define htonll
50#define ntohll
51#endif
52
53#ifndef htonll
54#if (BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN)
55#define htonll(x) ((uint64_t)htonl((uint32_t)((x) >> 32)) | \
56 (uint64_t)htonl((uint32_t)((x) & 0x00000000ffffffffULL)) << 32)
57#else /* (BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN) */
58#define htonll(x) (x)
59#endif
60#endif /* htonll */
61
62#ifndef ntohll
63#if (BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN)
64#define ntohll(x) ((uint64_t)ntohl((uint32_t)((x) >> 32)) | \
65 (uint64_t)ntohl((uint32_t)((x) & 0x00000000ffffffffULL)) << 32)
66#else /* (BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN) */
67#define ntohll(x) (x)
68#endif
69#endif /* ntohll */
70
71#define HMAC_LENGTH 16
72
73void
74dhcp_auth_reset(struct authstate *state)
75{
76
77 state->replay = 0;
78 if (state->token) {
79 free(state->token->key);
80 free(state->token->realm);
81 free(state->token);
82 state->token = NULL;
83 }
84 if (state->reconf) {
85 free(state->reconf->key);
86 free(state->reconf->realm);
87 free(state->reconf);
88 state->reconf = NULL;
89 }
90}
91
92/*
93 * Authenticate a DHCP message.
94 * m and mlen refer to the whole message.
95 * t is the DHCP type, pass it 4 or 6.
96 * data and dlen refer to the authentication option within the message.
97 */
98const struct token *
99dhcp_auth_validate(struct authstate *state, const struct auth *auth,
100 const void *vm, size_t mlen, int mp, int mt,
101 const void *vdata, size_t dlen)
102{
103 const uint8_t *m, *data;
104 uint8_t protocol, algorithm, rdm, *mm, type;
105 uint64_t replay;
106 uint32_t secretid;
107 const uint8_t *d, *realm;
108 size_t realm_len;
109 const struct token *t;
110 time_t now;
111 uint8_t hmac_code[HMAC_LENGTH];
112
113 if (dlen < 3 + sizeof(replay)) {
114 errno = EINVAL;
115 return NULL;
116 }
117
118 m = vm;
119 data = vdata;
120 /* Ensure that d is inside m which *may* not be the case for DHCPv4.
121 * This can occur if the authentication option is split using
122 * DHCP long option from RFC 3399. Section 9 which does infact note that
123 * implementations should take this into account.
124 * Fixing this would be problematic, patches welcome. */
125 if (data < m || data > m + mlen || data + dlen > m + mlen) {
126 errno = ERANGE;
127 return NULL;
128 }
129
130 d = data;
131 protocol = *d++;
132 algorithm = *d++;
133 rdm = *d++;
134 if (!(auth->options & DHCPCD_AUTH_SEND)) {
135 /* If we didn't send any authorisation, it can only be a
136 * reconfigure key */
137 if (protocol != AUTH_PROTO_RECONFKEY) {
138 errno = EINVAL;
139 return NULL;
140 }
141 } else if (protocol != auth->protocol ||
142 algorithm != auth->algorithm ||
143 rdm != auth->rdm)
144 {
145 /* As we don't require authentication, we should still
146 * accept a reconfigure key */
147 if (protocol != AUTH_PROTO_RECONFKEY ||
148 auth->options & DHCPCD_AUTH_REQUIRE)
149 {
150 errno = EPERM;
151 return NULL;
152 }
153 }
154 dlen -= 3;
155
156 memcpy(&replay, d, sizeof(replay));
157 replay = ntohll(replay);
158 /*
159 * Test for a replay attack.
160 *
161 * NOTE: Some servers always send a replay data value of zero.
162 * This is strictly compliant with RFC 3315 and 3318 which say:
163 * "If the RDM field contains 0x00, the replay detection field MUST be
164 * set to the value of a monotonically increasing counter."
165 * An example of a monotonically increasing sequence is:
166 * 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2
167 * Errata 3474 updates RFC 3318 to say:
168 * "If the RDM field contains 0x00, the replay detection field MUST be
169 * set to the value of a strictly increasing counter."
170 *
171 * Taking the above into account, dhcpcd will only test for
172 * strictly speaking replay attacks if it receives any non zero
173 * replay data to validate against.
174 */
175 if (state->token && state->replay != 0) {
176 if (state->replay == (replay ^ 0x8000000000000000ULL)) {
177 /* We don't know if the singular point is increasing
178 * or decreasing. */
179 errno = EPERM;
180 return NULL;
181 }
182 if ((uint64_t)(replay - state->replay) <= 0) {
183 /* Replay attack detected */
184 errno = EPERM;
185 return NULL;
186 }
187 }
188 d+= sizeof(replay);
189 dlen -= sizeof(replay);
190
191 realm = NULL;
192 realm_len = 0;
193
194 /* Extract realm and secret.
195 * Rest of data is MAC. */
196 switch (protocol) {
197 case AUTH_PROTO_TOKEN:
198 secretid = auth->token_rcv_secretid;
199 break;
200 case AUTH_PROTO_DELAYED:
201 if (dlen < sizeof(secretid) + sizeof(hmac_code)) {
202 errno = EINVAL;
203 return NULL;
204 }
205 memcpy(&secretid, d, sizeof(secretid));
206 secretid = ntohl(secretid);
207 d += sizeof(secretid);
208 dlen -= sizeof(secretid);
209 break;
210 case AUTH_PROTO_DELAYEDREALM:
211 if (dlen < sizeof(secretid) + sizeof(hmac_code)) {
212 errno = EINVAL;
213 return NULL;
214 }
215 realm_len = dlen - (sizeof(secretid) + sizeof(hmac_code));
216 if (realm_len) {
217 realm = d;
218 d += realm_len;
219 dlen -= realm_len;
220 }
221 memcpy(&secretid, d, sizeof(secretid));
222 secretid = ntohl(secretid);
223 d += sizeof(secretid);
224 dlen -= sizeof(secretid);
225 break;
226 case AUTH_PROTO_RECONFKEY:
227 if (dlen != 1 + 16) {
228 errno = EINVAL;
229 return NULL;
230 }
231 type = *d++;
232 dlen--;
233 switch (type) {
234 case 1:
235 if ((mp == 4 && mt == DHCP_ACK) ||
236 (mp == 6 && mt == DHCP6_REPLY))
237 {
238 if (state->reconf == NULL) {
239 state->reconf =
240 malloc(sizeof(*state->reconf));
241 if (state->reconf == NULL)
242 return NULL;
243 state->reconf->key = malloc(16);
244 if (state->reconf->key == NULL) {
245 free(state->reconf);
246 state->reconf = NULL;
247 return NULL;
248 }
249 state->reconf->secretid = 0;
250 state->reconf->expire = 0;
251 state->reconf->realm = NULL;
252 state->reconf->realm_len = 0;
253 state->reconf->key_len = 16;
254 }
255 memcpy(state->reconf->key, d, 16);
256 } else {
257 errno = EINVAL;
258 return NULL;
259 }
260 if (state->reconf == NULL)
261 errno = ENOENT;
262 /* Free the old token so we log acceptance */
263 if (state->token) {
264 free(state->token);
265 state->token = NULL;
266 }
267 /* Nothing to validate, just accepting the key */
268 return state->reconf;
269 case 2:
270 if (!((mp == 4 && mt == DHCP_FORCERENEW) ||
271 (mp == 6 && mt == DHCP6_RECONFIGURE)))
272 {
273 errno = EINVAL;
274 return NULL;
275 }
276 if (state->reconf == NULL) {
277 errno = ENOENT;
278 return NULL;
279 }
280 t = state->reconf;
281 goto gottoken;
282 default:
283 errno = EINVAL;
284 return NULL;
285 }
286 default:
287 errno = ENOTSUP;
288 return NULL;
289 }
290
291 /* Find a token for the realm and secret */
292 TAILQ_FOREACH(t, &auth->tokens, next) {
293 if (t->secretid == secretid &&
294 t->realm_len == realm_len &&
295 (t->realm_len == 0 ||
296 memcmp(t->realm, realm, t->realm_len) == 0))
297 break;
298 }
299 if (t == NULL) {
300 errno = ESRCH;
301 return NULL;
302 }
303 if (t->expire) {
304 if (time(&now) == -1)
305 return NULL;
306 if (t->expire < now) {
307 errno = EFAULT;
308 return NULL;
309 }
310 }
311
312gottoken:
313 /* First message from the server */
314 if (state->token &&
315 (state->token->secretid != t->secretid ||
316 state->token->realm_len != t->realm_len ||
317 memcmp(state->token->realm, t->realm, t->realm_len)))
318 {
319 errno = EPERM;
320 return NULL;
321 }
322
323 /* Special case as no hashing needs to be done. */
324 if (protocol == AUTH_PROTO_TOKEN) {
325 if (dlen != t->key_len || memcmp(d, t->key, dlen)) {
326 errno = EPERM;
327 return NULL;
328 }
329 goto finish;
330 }
331
332 /* Make a duplicate of the message, but zero out the MAC part */
333 mm = malloc(mlen);
334 if (mm == NULL)
335 return NULL;
336 memcpy(mm, m, mlen);
337 memset(mm + (d - m), 0, dlen);
338
339 /* RFC3318, section 5.2 - zero giaddr and hops */
340 if (mp == 4) {
341 /* Assert the bootp structure is correct size. */
342 __CTASSERT(sizeof(struct bootp) == 300);
343
344 *(mm + offsetof(struct bootp, hops)) = '\0';
345 memset(mm + offsetof(struct bootp, giaddr), 0, 4);
346 }
347
348 memset(hmac_code, 0, sizeof(hmac_code));
349 switch (algorithm) {
350 case AUTH_ALG_HMAC_MD5:
351 hmac("md5", t->key, t->key_len, mm, mlen,
352 hmac_code, sizeof(hmac_code));
353 break;
354 default:
355 errno = ENOSYS;
356 free(mm);
357 return NULL;
358 }
359
360 free(mm);
361 if (!consttime_memequal(d, &hmac_code, dlen)) {
362 errno = EPERM;
363 return NULL;
364 }
365
366finish:
367 /* If we got here then authentication passed */
368 state->replay = replay;
369 if (state->token == NULL) {
370 /* We cannot just save a pointer because a reconfigure will
371 * recreate the token list. So we duplicate it. */
372 state->token = malloc(sizeof(*state->token));
373 if (state->token) {
374 state->token->secretid = t->secretid;
375 state->token->key = malloc(t->key_len);
376 if (state->token->key) {
377 state->token->key_len = t->key_len;
378 memcpy(state->token->key, t->key, t->key_len);
379 } else {
380 free(state->token);
381 state->token = NULL;
382 return NULL;
383 }
384 if (t->realm_len) {
385 state->token->realm = malloc(t->realm_len);
386 if (state->token->realm) {
387 state->token->realm_len = t->realm_len;
388 memcpy(state->token->realm, t->realm,
389 t->realm_len);
390 } else {
391 free(state->token->key);
392 free(state->token);
393 state->token = NULL;
394 return NULL;
395 }
396 } else {
397 state->token->realm = NULL;
398 state->token->realm_len = 0;
399 }
400 }
401 /* If we cannot save the token, we must invalidate */
402 if (state->token == NULL)
403 return NULL;
404 }
405
406 return t;
407}
408
409static uint64_t
410get_next_rdm_monotonic_counter(struct auth *auth)
411{
412 FILE *fp;
413 uint64_t rdm;
414#ifdef LOCK_EX
415 int flocked;
416#endif
417
418 fp = fopen(RDM_MONOFILE, "r+");
419 if (fp == NULL) {
420 if (errno != ENOENT)
421 return ++auth->last_replay; /* report error? */
422 fp = fopen(RDM_MONOFILE, "w");
423 if (fp == NULL)
424 return ++auth->last_replay; /* report error? */
425#ifdef LOCK_EX
426 flocked = flock(fileno(fp), LOCK_EX);
427#endif
428 rdm = 0;
429 } else {
430#ifdef LOCK_EX
431 flocked = flock(fileno(fp), LOCK_EX);
432#endif
433 if (fscanf(fp, "0x%016" PRIu64, &rdm) != 1)
434 rdm = 0; /* truncated? report error? */
435 }
436
437 rdm++;
438 if (fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET) == -1 ||
439 ftruncate(fileno(fp), 0) == -1 ||
440 fprintf(fp, "0x%016" PRIu64 "\n", rdm) != 19 ||
441 fflush(fp) == EOF)
442 {
443 if (!auth->last_replay_set) {
444 auth->last_replay = rdm;
445 auth->last_replay_set = 1;
446 } else
447 rdm = ++auth->last_replay;
448 /* report error? */
449 }
450#ifdef LOCK_EX
451 if (flocked == 0)
452 flock(fileno(fp), LOCK_UN);
453#endif
454 fclose(fp);
455 return rdm;
456}
457
458#define NTP_EPOCH 2208988800U /* 1970 - 1900 in seconds */
459#define NTP_SCALE_FRAC 4294967295.0 /* max value of the fractional part */
460static uint64_t
461get_next_rdm_monotonic_clock(struct auth *auth)
462{
463 struct timespec ts;
464 uint64_t secs, rdm;
465 double frac;
466
467 if (clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &ts) != 0)
468 return ++auth->last_replay; /* report error? */
469
470 secs = (uint64_t)ts.tv_sec + NTP_EPOCH;
471 frac = ((double)ts.tv_nsec / 1e9 * NTP_SCALE_FRAC);
472 rdm = (secs << 32) | (uint64_t)frac;
473 return rdm;
474}
475
476static uint64_t
477get_next_rdm_monotonic(struct auth *auth)
478{
479
480 if (auth->options & DHCPCD_AUTH_RDM_COUNTER)
481 return get_next_rdm_monotonic_counter(auth);
482 return get_next_rdm_monotonic_clock(auth);
483}
484
485/*
486 * Encode a DHCP message.
487 * Either we know which token to use from the server response
488 * or we are using a basic configuration token.
489 * token is the token to encrypt with.
490 * m and mlen refer to the whole message.
491 * mp is the DHCP type, pass it 4 or 6.
492 * mt is the DHCP message type.
493 * data and dlen refer to the authentication option within the message.
494 */
495ssize_t
496dhcp_auth_encode(struct auth *auth, const struct token *t,
497 void *vm, size_t mlen, int mp, int mt,
498 void *vdata, size_t dlen)
499{
500 uint64_t rdm;
501 uint8_t hmac_code[HMAC_LENGTH];
502 time_t now;
503 uint8_t hops, *p, *m, *data;
504 uint32_t giaddr, secretid;
505 bool auth_info;
506
507 /* Ignore the token argument given to us - always send using the
508 * configured token. */
509 if (auth->protocol == AUTH_PROTO_TOKEN) {
510 TAILQ_FOREACH(t, &auth->tokens, next) {
511 if (t->secretid == auth->token_snd_secretid)
512 break;
513 }
514 if (t == NULL) {
515 errno = EINVAL;
516 return -1;
517 }
518 if (t->expire) {
519 if (time(&now) == -1)
520 return -1;
521 if (t->expire < now) {
522 errno = EPERM;
523 return -1;
524 }
525 }
526 }
527
528 switch(auth->protocol) {
529 case AUTH_PROTO_TOKEN:
530 case AUTH_PROTO_DELAYED:
531 case AUTH_PROTO_DELAYEDREALM:
532 /* We don't ever send a reconf key */
533 break;
534 default:
535 errno = ENOTSUP;
536 return -1;
537 }
538
539 switch(auth->algorithm) {
540 case AUTH_ALG_NONE:
541 case AUTH_ALG_HMAC_MD5:
542 break;
543 default:
544 errno = ENOTSUP;
545 return -1;
546 }
547
548 switch(auth->rdm) {
549 case AUTH_RDM_MONOTONIC:
550 break;
551 default:
552 errno = ENOTSUP;
553 return -1;
554 }
555
556 /* DISCOVER or INFORM messages don't write auth info */
557 if ((mp == 4 && (mt == DHCP_DISCOVER || mt == DHCP_INFORM)) ||
558 (mp == 6 && (mt == DHCP6_SOLICIT || mt == DHCP6_INFORMATION_REQ)))
559 auth_info = false;
560 else
561 auth_info = true;
562
563 /* Work out the auth area size.
564 * We only need to do this for DISCOVER messages */
565 if (vdata == NULL) {
566 dlen = 1 + 1 + 1 + 8;
567 switch(auth->protocol) {
568 case AUTH_PROTO_TOKEN:
569 dlen += t->key_len;
570 break;
571 case AUTH_PROTO_DELAYEDREALM:
572 if (auth_info && t)
573 dlen += t->realm_len;
574 /* FALLTHROUGH */
575 case AUTH_PROTO_DELAYED:
576 if (auth_info && t)
577 dlen += sizeof(t->secretid) + sizeof(hmac_code);
578 break;
579 }
580 return (ssize_t)dlen;
581 }
582
583 if (dlen < 1 + 1 + 1 + 8) {
584 errno = ENOBUFS;
585 return -1;
586 }
587
588 /* Ensure that d is inside m which *may* not be the case for DHPCPv4 */
589 m = vm;
590 data = vdata;
591 if (data < m || data > m + mlen || data + dlen > m + mlen) {
592 errno = ERANGE;
593 return -1;
594 }
595
596 /* Write out our option */
597 *data++ = auth->protocol;
598 *data++ = auth->algorithm;
599 /*
600 * RFC 3315 21.4.4.1 says that SOLICIT in DELAYED authentication
601 * should not set RDM or it's data.
602 * An expired draft draft-ietf-dhc-dhcpv6-clarify-auth-01 suggets
603 * this should not be set for INFORMATION REQ messages as well,
604 * which is probably a good idea because both states start from zero.
605 */
606 if (auth_info ||
607 !(auth->protocol & (AUTH_PROTO_DELAYED | AUTH_PROTO_DELAYEDREALM)))
608 {
609 *data++ = auth->rdm;
610 switch (auth->rdm) {
611 case AUTH_RDM_MONOTONIC:
612 rdm = get_next_rdm_monotonic(auth);
613 break;
614 default:
615 /* This block appeases gcc, clang doesn't need it */
616 rdm = get_next_rdm_monotonic(auth);
617 break;
618 }
619 rdm = htonll(rdm);
620 memcpy(data, &rdm, 8);
621 } else {
622 *data++ = 0; /* rdm */
623 memset(data, 0, 8); /* replay detection data */
624 }
625 data += 8;
626 dlen -= 1 + 1 + 1 + 8;
627
628 /* Special case as no hashing needs to be done. */
629 if (auth->protocol == AUTH_PROTO_TOKEN) {
630 /* Should be impossible, but still */
631 if (t == NULL) {
632 errno = EINVAL;
633 return -1;
634 }
635 if (dlen < t->key_len) {
636 errno = ENOBUFS;
637 return -1;
638 }
639 memcpy(data, t->key, t->key_len);
640 return (ssize_t)(dlen - t->key_len);
641 }
642
643 /* DISCOVER or INFORM messages don't write auth info */
644 if (!auth_info)
645 return (ssize_t)dlen;
646
647 /* Loading a saved lease without an authentication option */
648 if (t == NULL)
649 return 0;
650
651 /* Write out the Realm */
652 if (auth->protocol == AUTH_PROTO_DELAYEDREALM) {
653 if (dlen < t->realm_len) {
654 errno = ENOBUFS;
655 return -1;
656 }
657 memcpy(data, t->realm, t->realm_len);
658 data += t->realm_len;
659 dlen -= t->realm_len;
660 }
661
662 /* Write out the SecretID */
663 if (auth->protocol == AUTH_PROTO_DELAYED ||
664 auth->protocol == AUTH_PROTO_DELAYEDREALM)
665 {
666 if (dlen < sizeof(t->secretid)) {
667 errno = ENOBUFS;
668 return -1;
669 }
670 secretid = htonl(t->secretid);
671 memcpy(data, &secretid, sizeof(secretid));
672 data += sizeof(secretid);
673 dlen -= sizeof(secretid);
674 }
675
676 /* Zero what's left, the MAC */
677 memset(data, 0, dlen);
678
679 /* RFC3318, section 5.2 - zero giaddr and hops */
680 if (mp == 4) {
681 p = m + offsetof(struct bootp, hops);
682 hops = *p;
683 *p = '\0';
684 p = m + offsetof(struct bootp, giaddr);
685 memcpy(&giaddr, p, sizeof(giaddr));
686 memset(p, 0, sizeof(giaddr));
687 } else {
688 /* appease GCC again */
689 hops = 0;
690 giaddr = 0;
691 }
692
693 /* Create our hash and write it out */
694 switch(auth->algorithm) {
695 case AUTH_ALG_HMAC_MD5:
696 hmac("md5", t->key, t->key_len, m, mlen,
697 hmac_code, sizeof(hmac_code));
698 memcpy(data, hmac_code, sizeof(hmac_code));
699 break;
700 }
701
702 /* RFC3318, section 5.2 - restore giaddr and hops */
703 if (mp == 4) {
704 p = m + offsetof(struct bootp, hops);
705 *p = hops;
706 p = m + offsetof(struct bootp, giaddr);
707 memcpy(p, &giaddr, sizeof(giaddr));
708 }
709
710 /* Done! */
711 return (int)(dlen - sizeof(hmac_code)); /* should be zero */
712}
